text: I would be surprised if same vs. different arm made a difference since a vaccine distributes around the body. At least there’s no reason for me to believe that it stays in the arm.

elements.text: I would be surprised if same vs. different arm made a difference since a vaccine distributes around the body. At least there’s no reason for me to believe that it stays in the arm.

text: I’ve heard this as a quantity vs. quality argument: re-train the ~same T cells vs train more?

elements.text: I’ve heard this as a quantity vs. quality argument: re-train the ~same T cells vs train more?

text: But I also have no idea what I’m talking about :stuck_out_tongue:

elements.text: But I also have no idea what I’m talking about

text: It’s a lot easier to talk without knowing, sometimes.

elements.text: It’s a lot easier to talk without knowing, sometimes.

text: No, your t cells and b cells travel around exploring all the lymph nodes and other secondary lymphoid organs. The vaccine itself probably doesn't make it past your arm pit, but the immune response will

elements.text: No, your t cells and b cells travel around exploring all the lymph nodes and other secondary lymphoid organs. The vaccine itself probably doesn't make it past your arm pit, but the immune response will

text: So no, shouldn't matter which arm you get either dose

elements.text: So no, shouldn't matter which arm you get either dose
